result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on December 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Jerrell Coats not in court.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Jerrell Coats.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant to appear in person for anticipated resolution.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jerrell Coats in court.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Jerrell Coats.

Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Per request of Atty. Beltran, 8-03-2022 hearing rescheduled to 2:45 p.m.

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Edgar Beltran in person.  Court addresses defense motion to modify bond.  Argument by counsel.  Pretrial held and offer pending.  Court denies motion to modify bond.
Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Notice of Motion & Motion to Modify Bond

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Edgar Beltran via video.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.  Not guilty pleas entered by Court.  State requests cash bond.  Argument on bond.  $500 cash bond set.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:45 am.
